title: Sagamore Hill National Historic Site: Places
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Places              Places        Old Orchard, home of Theodore Roosevelt Jr. Photo taken 1938-1939 NPS   Â    Old Orchard was the home of Theodore Roosevelt Jr. and his wife Eleanor. It was built from 1937-1938 and served as a private residence until Eleanor's death in 1960. In 1962 the home was donated to the National Park Service. Today it serves as the Old Orchard Museum. The Old Orchard Museum has an exhibit about Theodore Roosevelt's life, a theater that plays biographical films about Theodore Roosevelt, and rotating exhibits. For more information about the history of the building and photos of the building refer to the links below:  Old Orchard Museum History Old Orchard Photos Operating hours for the museum: Wednesday-Sunday 10am -  5pm.
